bug.author: mbforbes
bug.summary: `pipe(...)` only POS tags the final item?
bug.description:
I've been using pipe(...) to process a sequence of texts in parallel, but I recently noticed that only the final document is POS tagged: import spacy sp = spacy.load('en') [print(p) for p in sp.pipeline]
for doc in sp.pipe(['Sentence 1.', 'Sentence 2.', 'Sentence 3.']): print('txt: "{}", parsed: {}, tagged: {}'.format( doc, doc.is_parsed, doc.is_tagged)) outputs: <denchmark-code>('tagger', <spacy.pipeline.Tagger object at 0x7fba7f55c748>) ('parser', <spacy.pipeline.DependencyParser object at 0x7fba7f44c468>) ('ner', <spacy.pipeline.EntityRecognizer object at 0x7fba7f44c4c0>) txt: "Sentence 1.", parsed: True, tagged: False txt: "Sentence 2.", parsed: True, tagged: False txt: "Sentence 3.", parsed: True, tagged: True </denchmark-code>
If I run this over 20 items, only the last 1 is tagged. However, if I run this over 10,000 items, 10 get tagged (they are widely spread apart). <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: Ubuntu (same result on macOS)
python -m spacy info --markdown on Ubuntu:
spaCy version: 2.0.11 Platform: Linux-4.4.0-116-generic-x86_64-with-debian-stretch-sid Python version: 3.6.2 Models: en, en_core_web_lg

comments.comment: Thanks for the report – I'm pretty sure this was caused by an unfortunate typo that would cause to not be set correctly. We've already fixed this in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/commit/5ecb274764b085bd6fe49fcc573618e430051259>5ecb274</denchmark-link> . The fix is also included in the current development release – so if you want, you could test it with v2.0.12.dev0 and see if the problem is resolved? pip install spacy==v2.0.12.dev0
Phew! You're right, it is fixed in v2.0.12.dev0. Thank you for the prompt reply!
